title: Arsenal news: Garth Crooks lays into Arsene Wenger | Metro News
text:
Search Metro Follow us Video: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger told to ‘take a break from the game’ in scathing attack by Garth Crooks Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Saturday 11 Feb 2017 3:06 pm To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
Former Tottenham star Garth Crooks believes it may be time for Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger to take a break from football as he appears to lose his cool. 
The Frenchman served the final game of a four-match touchline ban today as his Arsenal side overcame Hull City 2-0 at the Emirates Stadium. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
The ban came from Wenger’s push on fourth official Anthony Taylor at the end of the Gunners’ recent victory over Burnley, and Crooks is worried that his outbursts are becoming something of a pattern. 
Wenger has been involved with a number of other high-profile clashes with opposition managers and officials down the years, and Crooks thinks he may now be too old to handle the pressure of at the top level of the game. Arsene Wenger is nearing the end of his Arsenal contract (Picture: Getty) Wenger recently got a four-game ban for a push on fourth official Anthony Taylor (Picture: Getty) 
‘I’ve got some really big concerns and they’ve gathered over the years,’ Crooks told Final Score. 
‘First of all, when he actually pushed Alan Pardew – very unusual, out of character. It happened again with Martin Jol. And again with Jose Mourinho. And then with the referee, or the fourth official.
